title.value: ADRENAL GLAND: Biopsy (Core Needle, Incisional, Excisional); Resection

text.value: Protocol applies to adrenal cortical carcinoma only. Cortical adenomas, pheochromocytoma, neuroblastic tumors, and adrenal tumors of childhood are not included.

display.value: Urinary 17-ketosteroids increased (10 mg / g creatinine / 24 hours)

text.value: Additional dimensions (repeat section if more than one part)
Treatment Effect (applicable to carcinomas treated with neoadjuvant therapy)

display.value: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor
pT1: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension, no extra-adrenal invasion
pT2: Tumor greater than 5cm, no extra-adrenal invasion
pT3: Tumor of any size with local invasion, but not invading adjacent organs#

code.value: pT4: Tumor of any size with invasion of adjacent organs#

text.value: # Adjacent organs include kidney, diaphragm, great vessels, pancreas, and liver.
Note: There is no category of carcinoma in situ (pTis) relative to carcinomas of the adrenal gland.

display.value: pN0: No regional lymph node metastisis
